title: Why do people look at past seasons with such rose tinted glasses?
body:
Like holy shit, you would think there were no problems in Season 4/5/6.

The game is way more balanced now than it was back then, prove me wrong.

replies.body:
people look at almost everything with rose colored glasses honestly.

"the good ole days" have never been today.

Well to be fair, look at the LCS today vs. the past and tell me which one was enjoyable to watch. Which version of Faker did you like the one who went for big plays or the one who farms mid?
Probably because they're better than this season.

> [{quoted}](name=GinormousVner,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8YhW96QA,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-04-20T18:23:30.429+0000)
>
> Like holy shit, you would think there were no problems in Season 4/5/6.
> 
> The game is way more balanced now than it was back then, prove me wrong.

You’re kidding right? S3-6 the only things that could one shot were high single target damage assassins such as leblanc, now if you build for it a majority of damage dealers can oneshot someone.

Back  in s2-5 CC was an actual consideration for team comp, nowadays your whole team could random select and 99 times out of 100 you’ll have enough cc to chain cc at least two of the enemies to death in a team fight.

But yeah, more balanced than ever

I don't think it's "more balanced than ever" but there's always been problems of this magnitude that people on this board whine about nonstop. It's really not something Riot is doing, people have just been playing this game for too long and are getting bored with it, just like every other game.

No doubt people always complain, the difference is the magnitude of the contents of the complaint, barring the Wild West that was season 1 ie. ~~~~sunfire stacking twitch, red elixir lvl 1 FB shaco, seasons 2-6 balance issues were significantly less debilitating than the issues are now
Yeah I enjoy watching tanks and hyper carries in the lcs every game. U rite.

The comparison is to show how bad things are now, not how good things were back then.

I honestly just think all these people who been playing for a while are just getting tired of the game because they've been playing it so long, not because of something Riot's doing. The circlejerking on this site has really gotten out of hand.
But yes, I agree, this is a problem I've noticed. People tend to view everything in the past with rose-tinted glasses.. I heard some people say that prework Kat was better than rework Kat. What?! She was even more braindead and feast-or-famine then she is now, and had no real theme or direction.
I miss Morello.

Well... we could start proofing this statement first . dont you think so - lol. x'D

But anyway, I considered late Seaons5 meta absolutely awesome and close to prefect (before juggernauts steamroled everyone and everything and Fiora topk care of anyone who dared to stand up again) - not looking back with tinted classes - I did so WHILE playing in Season5. 

So yeah - quite obvious case for me. ^^
atleast it was fun lol
No it isn't but sure you got that contrarian itch I won't stop you from scratching at it in public

For the same reason people think the prequels are actually good now that the nu-trilogy is out. Its called nostalgia. Objectivity is destroyed when past experiences are tinted with good memories of "the better days".  I was 12 years old when RotS came out and life was easy and good so of course the prequels were good films!

The average person is too dumb to realize that when they were playing League S3 they didn't have 3000 hours of game burnout influencing their thought process. The game was something new and exciting and times were easier with less responsibilities. Therefore it was "a better game".

For me personally, its because I really did enjoy season 5 more. I had the most fun during the burning tides event, but ever since then it seems like Riot either got cocky or lazy. The end of season 6 (imo) was alright, but some terrible decisions and lack of thinking ahead from Riot have hurt game play quality. I'll admit that from what I've seen about mid season so far, it's looking pretty good on paper(again imo).
